DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis Performed Observation Outcome Priority at Discharge Code Sentinel CDM Principal Discharge Diagnosis Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Executed and carried through to completion._Watching something and taking note of what happens._The result of an action._A coded value specifying the degree to which a condition is established to be chiefly responsible for occasioning the admission of the patient._Principal discharge diagnosis flag. Relevant only on IP and IS encounters. For ED, AV, and OA encounter types, mark as missing. One principal diagnosis is expected, although in some instances more than one diagnosis may be flagged as principal.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnosis Performed Observation Outcome Priority At Patient Discharge Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Executed and carried through to completion._Watching something and taking note of what happens._The result of an action._A status established by order of importance or urgency._Used to indicate position, location, or state._The release of a patient from a course of care._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDM based on BRIDG 5.1 mc 8.27.18 Changed Property concepts for consistency with BRIDG annotations

ValueDomain.preferredName: Sentinel CDM Principal Discharge Diagnosis Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Principal discharge diagnosis flag. Relevant only on IP and IS encounters. For ED, AV, and OA encounter types, mark as missing. One principal diagnosis is expected, although in some instances more than one diagnosis may be flagged as principal.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.

Concepts.definition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An inability to assign something to the existing classifications or categories.

Concepts.definition: An inability to assign something to the existing classifications or categories.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

DataElement.changeDescription: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.1 and Sentinel value set for CDM.
